intro: Schollia carnosa, commonly known as the woolly false heather, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are leathery and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, woolly appearance. Schollia carnosa is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
